alert.note: Alert for Outagamie; Waupaca (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 5:55AM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Waupaca and northwestern Outagamie Counties through 645 AM CDT... At 552 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms from Symco to Bear Creek, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, nickel size hail and torrential rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Urban and small stream flooding is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Waupaca and northwestern Outagamie Counties, including the following locations... Fitzgerald Corners, Symco, Sugar Bush, Manawa, Wolf River Bottoms Wildlife Area and Bear Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
